rule-5-20-a.test_description: Building includes hotel and office vertical fenestration building area types. Each building segment includes a conditioned zone with an exterior wall with windows.

standard.ruleset_reference:
Table G3.1 #5 baseline column #c: Where a building has multiple building area types, each
type shall use the values in the table.
standard.rule_description: Where a building has multiple building area types, each type shall use the values in the table.

rule-5-20-b.test_description: Building includes hotel and office vertical fenestration building area types. Each building segment includes a conditioned zone with an exterior wall with windows.

standard.ruleset_reference:
Table G3.1 #5 baseline column #c: Where a building has multiple building area types, each
type shall use the values in the table.
standard.rule_description: Where a building has multiple building area types, each type shall use the values in the table.

rule-5-21-a.test_description: Building includes a zone that has two exterior walls with windows. Vertical fenestration area in the baseline model is distributed on each face in the same proportion as in the proposed design.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #5 baseline column #c: The vertical fenestration shall be distributed on each face of the building in the same proportion as in the proposed design.
standard.rule_description: The vertical fenestration shall be distributed on each face of the building in the same proportion as in the proposed design

rule-5-21-b.test_description: Building includes a zone that has two exterior walls with windows. Vertical fenestration area in the baseline model is not distributed on each face in the same proportion as in the proposed design.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #5 baseline column #c: The vertical fenestration shall be distributed on each face of the building in the same proportion as in the proposed design.
standard.rule_description: The vertical fenestration shall be distributed on each face of the building in the same proportion as in the proposed design

rule-5-22-a.test_description: Building is existing. The baseline fenestration area must be checked manually.

standard.ruleset_reference: Table G3.1 #5 baseline column #c:  The fenestration area for an existing building shall equal the existing fenestration area prior to the proposed work and shall be distributed on each face of the building in the same proportions as the existing building.
standard.rule_description: The baseline fenestration area for an existing building shall equal the existing fenestration area prior to the proposed work

rule-5-23-a.test_description: fenestration area on each surface in the proposed design is the same as in the user model

standard.ruleset_reference:
G3.1 #1 (a) The simulation model of the proposed design shall be consistent
with the design documents…
standard.rule_description: Fenestration area in the proposed design must be as-designed

rule-5-23-b.test_description: fenestration area on each surface in the proposed design is the same as in the user model

standard.ruleset_reference:
G3.1 #1 (a) The simulation model of the proposed design shall be consistent
with the design documents…
standard.rule_description: Fenestration area in the proposed design must be as-designed

rule-5-24-a.test_description: A space has residential occupancy type and is conditioned based on heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that servies it. Building is located in climate zone 4A. The baseline vertical fenestration U-factor is established correctly.

standard.ruleset_reference:
Table G3.1 #5Baseline column #d: Vertical Fenestration Assemblies. Fenestration for new
buildings, existing buildings, and additions shall comply with the following: 
• Fenestration U-factors shall match the appropriate requirements in Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 for the applicable glazing percentage for Uall.
standard.rule_description: Vertical fenestration U-factors for residential, non-residential and semiheated spaces in the baseline model must match the appropriate requirements in Table G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 for the appropriate WWR in the baseline RMR.
standard.rule_dependency:
1. Baseline heating and cooling capacities are established correctly (air-side HVAC rule TBD). This affects baseline space conditioning categories
2. Baseline fenestration area is established correctly (Rules 18, 19, 20)

rule-5-24-b.test_description: A space has residential occupancy type and is conditioned based on heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that servies it. Building is located in climate zone 4A. The baseline vertical fenestration U-factor is established correctly.

rule-5-25-a.test_description: Fenestration U-Factor is the same in user model and proposed design model

standard.ruleset_reference:
G3.1 #1 (a) The simulation model of the proposed design shall be consistent
with the design documents…
standard.rule_description: Fenestration (window and skylight) U-factors in the proposed model must match the user model

rule-5-25-b.test_description: Fenestration U-Factor is not the same in user model and proposed design model

standard.ruleset_reference:
G3.1 #1 (a) The simulation model of the proposed design shall be consistent
with the design documents…
standard.rule_description: Fenestration (window and skylight) U-factors in the proposed model must match the user model
